confine.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject
confine.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The police cadet’s duties were confined to taking statements from the crowd.
We confined our study to ten cases.
Owen did not confine himself to writing only one type of poem.
confine.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to keep someone in a place that they cannot leave, such as a prison
confine.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Any soldier who leaves his post will be confined to barracks  (=made to stay in the barracks).
He was allegedly confined in a narrow dark room for two months.
confine.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to stop something bad from spreading to another place
confine.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Firefighters managed to confine the fire to the living room.
confine.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if you are confined to a place, you have to stay in that place, especially because you are ill
confine.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Vaughan is confined to a wheelchair.
She’s confined to bed with flu.
confine.translation[0].definitions[3].no: Confine is usually passive in this meaning
